fields.description:
Add a single document for each supported server (Orion, JBoss etc) - giving the set of steps to be followed to setup JIRA on that server.

This is also a useful place to put tips related to individual servers (ie turn on feature X for speed etc).
fields.summary: Add setup documents for each supported server

fields.description:
99% of the users out there will want to cache all this data as it is very frequently accessed and very infrequently updated.

Add a JIRA option to turn this on and off.

Cache should proactively fill itself - so as to result in minimum SQL statements overall - and the refresh pause is only during project admin tasks (where it doesn't matter).
fields.summary: Add ability to cache project/version/component data

fields.description:
When using the quick link (either from top right of page, or from home page), and use an invalid key, a NPE is thrown.

This is not caught & you get a raw error page.
fields.summary: NPE if key is not found for issue

fields.description: It'd be nice if JIRA could make changelogs for you (doesn't have to be fancy, we could edit it later to look nice).
fields.summary: Ability to make change logs

fields.description:
Script (JSP most probably) to perform upgrades between versions (from old version to newly installed version). 

Script should perform all upgrades in order (ie 1.0->1.1, 1.1->1.2 etc).

Administrator logging into the admin interface should be notified an upgrade is needed.
fields.summary: Upgrade facility

fields.description:
The email that goes out when issues are assigned contains

"The following issue has been assigned to you."

The "you" is misleading because it goes out to all watchers of the issue. It should be replaced with the email of the assignee (and perhaps name too) like:

"The following issue has been assigned to Scott Farquhar (mailto:scott@atlassian.com)"
fields.summary: Assigned Email should indicate email of assignee

fields.description: uploading files is pretty important for being able to send screenshots, etc.
fields.summary: woudl like to be able to upload files

fields.description:
Having multiple instances of Jira open in different browser windows it is almost impossible to tell them apart.

Having the title of the installation in the window title (and maybe somewhere at the top of the page) would be helpful.
fields.summary: Better distinction between installations

fields.description:
(from Matt Tucker)

Anchors on top nav should be linked to the Mouseover area, not the 
text. Minor, but annoying when you see that the color has changed but 
you still can't click through. Same for the 'T', 'Key', 'Summary' 
headers in the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Tabs in navbar aren't all clickable

fields.description:
(from Matt Tucker)
Fix odd status indicator that says a issue is assigned when the 
assignee is actually 'None' (Issue Navigator). Should really say
unassigned.
fields.summary: Odd 'Assigned' status indicator

fields.description:
Users on JBoss currently don't get bodies in their email - the email has a subject but blank body.

Good summary of the bug in the mailing list archive: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jsp?forum=46&thread=1159

For now, the workaround is to move templates/* directory from inside the atlassian-jira-ejb.jar file to the jboss/lib/ext directory.

We'll fix this in 1.1.
fields.summary: JBoss sends blank emails

fields.description:
(from Matt Tucker)

It would be nice to show which user you are currently logged in as - in the top right hand corner presumably.
fields.summary: Show which user you are logged in as

fields.description:
(from Matt Tucker)

In the Issue Navigator, the summary of an issue should be linked - probably with an invisible link so that it does not disturb the aesthetics of the page.
fields.summary: Link Issue Summaries in Navigator

fields.description:
(from Matt Tucker)

The View Issue box should trim the text entered before looking it up.
fields.summary: View Issue box should trim entry

fields.description:
Build a proper permissioning system for JIRA. 

First, we need to add the ability to create arbitrary groups. There will also be a group 'Guests'.

Permissions allow a particular group to perform a particular operation (such as 'Browse Project', 'Create Issue', 'Assign Issue' etc)

Permissions are either global or per project.
fields.summary: Permissioning System

fields.description:
(suggested by Matt Tucker)

Build a Jive forums filter which highlights issue keys and links them directly to a JIRA installation.

The filter would need a single init parameter, which would be the base URL of a JIRA installation.
fields.summary: Jive Forums Filter

fields.description: don't know how to connect
fields.summary: NO Connect

fields.description: View the current filter in Excel.
fields.summary: Excel view of Navigator

fields.description: I would like to setup several projects and let customers access their specific project information. Other customers' projects may not be accessible for a user. I did not find a setting to assign a user to a project, it seems that a user can by default see all projects.
fields.summary: Cannot assign users to different projects

fields.description:
Many people have been asking for this and it solves a bunch of problems.

Basically customisable issue workflow, using OSWorkflow.
fields.summary: Workflow support

fields.description: The is valid at least for jira.atlassian.com .
fields.summary: Browse Project|Popular issues is empty

fields.description:
Example, when sorting through users, "Andrew" should be next to "andrew".

This may mean changing ofBiz.  The offending call seems to be:

GenericValue.getRelatedOrderBy()
fields.summary: When ordering by alphanumeric, treat upper and lower case the same

fields.description: Would be nice if the roadmap showed status of the issues in it (ie, resolved/open/cannot reproduce etc). This allows one to quickly see the items scheduled for the next versions, as well as pending ones that still need to be fixed
fields.summary: Roadmap view enhancement

fields.description: Administrators should be able to delete comments.
fields.summary: Deleting comments

fields.description:
When deleting a component or version, you can currently swap the issues in that module to another module of the same type.

You should be able to unschedule them from any module.

ie issues in component Foo should be able to be moved to component Bar, or alternatively to no component at all.
fields.summary: When deleting version/component - cannot make unschedule issue!

fields.description:
The currently active report should be 'unlinked'. This makes it easy to visually discern which report is active.

See JRA-209 for details.
fields.summary: Distinguish which report is the active report

fields.description: Certify and test JIRA on JRun 4.0 beta (Nozumi). Document it once we get it working.
fields.summary: Test latest JRun 4 release

fields.description: Certify that JIRA deploys and runs on Pramati 3.0 and also provide installation instructions.
fields.summary: Pramati support certified

fields.description: It would be nice to allow two or more people to be assigned to a single item. This is useful for when the task is quite large but can't be broken down in to subtasks either.
fields.summary: Allow multiple assignees to a single task

fields.description: shortcuts to "view my issues" and/or "view unresolved issues"  etc from main page? would be nice to not have to go through 2 or 3 pages to get there.
fields.summary: Common issue filter shortcuts

fields.description:
after logging in, going to this page, and restarting the server, I tried to submit the form and boom:

fields.summary: Glitch in servlet filter after restart

fields.description:
It seems like poor old Netscape doesn't understand hexadecimal escaping of special characters. The letter ? is rendered as ?xF6; which isn't really that readable.

The interface is much nicer, but in a non-english environment it is still useless under Netscape 4.
fields.summary: I18N: Escaped characters does not work in Netscape 4

fields.description:
Currently, the services thread runs regardless of whether any services are registered. 

Need to improve the services thread management.
fields.summary: Adjust Services so that the thread does not run if services do not exist

fields.description:
/jira/secure/DeleteIssue!default.jspa?id=10012

everything seems to work ok, but I try to delete previously existing issue and I get redirected to the URL above. instead of a delete issue page, I get a login page, only it looks messed up - it's the login form table (miniwindow) except spread 100% across the screen - I can tell it's not supposed to look like this.
fields.summary: Asked to re-authenticate to delete issue

fields.description: Could not display Chinese characters. When I added Chinese in the "comment" on bug entry form, then click "add" button. The page was returned with ????? chacters.
fields.summary: i18N: could not support Chinese

fields.description:
The admin interface tries to reset the project lead if the user does not exist anymore.

This change is not being persisted, so the change is made every time you request the page.
fields.summary: Project lead is not reset properly

fields.description:
If I clicked on Open Issues/Road Map/Change Log or Popular issues, I should not be able to click on them again, because they are visible. Maybe it could be done the tab-like looking at http://scarab.tigris.org/ ?

The same applies to Find Issues and the Preset Filters on the left. If one selected for example Outstanding, you could not see, what filter is is responsible for the entries.
The best solution would be to hide the link (the entry should remain) on the left side and show "Outstanding Issues" above the table.
fields.summary: Can't distinguish, what filter is applied
"Won't Fix" issues does not occur in Browse Project|Change Log

fields.description:
The priority list is currently hardcoded in (I think), this needs to be externalised for a number of reasons:

1) Internationalisations support
2) Custom priority levels

I would suggest using resourcebundles, and allowing for any number of keys. Internally JIRA should store the number and not its string representation. So for example, by default priorities.properties would contain:

priority.1=Blocker
priority.2=Critical
priority.3=Major
priority.4=Minor
priority.5=Trivial

Users should then add or remove to this list as they see fit, and deploy with their own set of custom priorities, internationalisation (in this one small case!) would then become trivial as well.
fields.summary: Allow for custom priorities

fields.description: I have the Find issues table open (with a list of issues). Now I pick an issue by clicking on it's key. I add an comment. How I can come back easily to my Find issues table (for exactly that filter criteria)?
fields.summary: Back to Find issues table (from comment)

fields.description:
After export XML to file, (i.e. after a POST /jira/secure/admin/ExportAll.jspa), a link to the file containing the XML data is given but it leads to a 404 :  

404 Not Found
Resource /jira/secure/admin/jira-1.0RC4-export not found on this server

Note: "jira-1.0RC4-export" is the name I entered as filename.
fields.summary: The link shown after successfull export to a file leads to a 404

fields.description:
After export (to file) is completed, /jira/secure/admin/ExportAll.jspa says:

  " Cut and paste the XML representation of a project from below and save it in a file."

but the XML have already been generated to a file and no representation of it is in the page.
fields.summary: Comment says "cut and paste the XML representation..." even when data have been exporte to a file

fields.description: After many releases, the changelog page can get very long. It'd be nice if it showed the last 3 releases only, with a 'view all history' link at the bottom to view the whole thing
fields.summary: Changelog page can get very long

fields.summary: Unable to browse issues in latest OC4j

fields.description:
On a new release, I edit the entity*.xml file for my Oracle datasource, run ant orion, copy the .ear to $ORION_HOME/applications and edit the server.xml so the jira application points to the new ear.

When the server.xml is saved, the new .ear is noticed by orion and auto-unpacked (as well as the .war).  However, on bootstrap of this new application (not sure if it bootstraps itself or if it is on response to the first hit on jira home URL), webwork.config.XMLActionConfiguration still uses the previous location ($ORION_HOME/applications/atlassian-jira-1.0RC2 versus $ORION_HOME/applications/atlassian-jira-1.0RC3).

Is it unreasonnable to expect hot deploy of a new version ?  

For the time being, I would suggest mentionning that an orion server restart is needed (or maybe I didn't read the doc/instructions correctly ...).
fields.summary: Hot Deploy : should it be possible ?

fields.description:
When adding a task it would be useful if a DUE DATE could be included (if applicable).  That way email reminders could be sent out to the assignee reminding them when a task needs to be completed.  

The system could then highlight those tasks that are OVERDUE in nice big red letters as a reminder to everyone.
fields.summary: Add Task Due Date

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to run a filter that views all tasks within a project and all associated comments rather than just the task/issue headings.  

i.e for each issue
* summary
* priority
* description
* comments
* date

After running the filter, the complete project list could then be printed out.  This printout could then be discussed in the meeting without the need for a terminal in the room.
fields.summary: View all project issues on one web page

fields.description: If a project is opened, it would be sufficient to enter a number in the VIEW ISSUE # field to jump to that issue.
fields.summary: Allow number only in VIEW ISSUE #

fields.description: see Summary
fields.summary: On Opera the login "dialog" hangs on the left side

fields.description: Maybe it's to much hidden, but I would find it useful to be able to change the email settings that you currently only can set while JIRA's Setup.
fields.summary: Ability to change the email setting

fields.description: I would find it useful if one could change attributes (e.g. the "Fix for version") for a set of issues at once. Now it is a little bit fussy.
fields.summary: Ability to change attributes for a set of issues

fields.description:
upon logging in, I am directed to /secuer instead of /jira/secure on my webserver.

If i enter incorrect u/p, it behaves correctly, and I can go to jira/secure after the misdirection and will access the main page ok.
fields.summary: login page redirection error

fields.summary: parameters['list'] is null

fields.description:
Here's an email from jira.. check the Created field.

From: legendaryservice@atlassian.com
Date: Wed Apr 03, 2002  01:43:55 PM US/Central
To: mike@atlassian.com, ipojman@jmlafferty.com
Subject: [JIRA] New comment: (JRA-189) RC2 doesnt work? XMLUtils not found

The following comment has been added to this issue:

     Author: Ian Pojman
    Created: $formatter.format($action.getTimestamp("created"))
       Body:
I have JIRA running now - I had to make a jar from com/atlassian/jira/config and com/atlassian/jira/util from the 0.8.6 distribution to get around NoClassDefFound errors.
fields.summary: Created field in email formatted wrong

fields.description:
[ERROR,EmbeddedCatalinaServiceSX] StandardContext[/temp/]: Exception starting filter security

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/util/XMLUtils
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.config.SecurityConfig.getInitParameters(SecurityConfig.java:205)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.config.SecurityConfig.configureParameters(SecurityConfig.java:155)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.config.SecurityConfig.init(SecurityConfig.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.config.SecurityConfig.<init>(SecurityConfig.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.SecurityFilter.init(SecurityFilter.java:49)
fields.summary: RC2 doesnt work? XMLUtils not found

fields.description: See subject ;)
fields.summary: Shouldn't be able to vote for resolved issues

fields.description:
Oracle 9iAS 9.0.3.0.0 gives weird errors to do with transactions.

Test and fix before RC3.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't work on OC4J Release 3

fields.description:
JIRA cannot be used in a 'disconnected' server at the moment because OFBiz looks up DTDs from ofbiz.org.

Easily fixed - from David Jones: 

"The OFBiz UtilXml class will load DTDs from the classpath if they're available AND if the localdtds.properties file is on the classpath.

It only looks up the DTDs on the www.ofbiz.org site if they aren't found locally."
fields.summary: Cannot start JIRA with no net connection

fields.description:
The instruction in "create new user" form (jira/secure/admin/user/AddUser.jspa) claims:

   If you do not enter a password, one will be generated for the user automatically.

but an empty password field is not accepted : the password field is highlighted (pink'ish background) with "No password specified" error message.
fields.summary: Empty password not accepted in create new user (AddUser.jspa) despite claim in instructions

fields.description:
Deleting an issue works fine, however the redirect back to the issue navigator after deleting the issue doesn't work properly (at least on 1.0RC1).

Probably this redirect is pointing back to view issue (like the others - assign/resolve etc), rather than the issue navigator?
fields.summary: Redirect after Delete don't work

fields.description:
I get this exception now and then, basically the user is bull, and jira isn't picking that up and dealing with it correctly, instead of passing it on to osuser.

java.lang.NullPointerException: Primary key was null, make sure you are not passing a null primary key or a composite primary key with null fields
        at UserHome_EntityHomeWrapper58.hashCode(UserHome_EntityHomeWrapper58.java:151)
        at com.evermind.util.ExternalHashSet.get(.:37)
        at UserHome_EntityHomeWrapper58.findByPrimaryKey(UserHome_EntityHomeWrapper58.java:230)
        at com.formicary.intranet.user.UserModuleBean.getUser(UserModuleBean.java:99)
        at UserModule_StatelessSessionBeanWrapper53.getUser(UserModule_StatelessSessionBeanWrapper53.java:140)
        at com.formicary.intranet.security.PortalCredentialsProvider.handles(PortalCredentialsProvider.java:155)
        at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getProvider(UserManager.java:315)
        at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getEntity(UserManager.java:277)
        at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getUser(UserManager.java:109)
        at com.atlassian.jira.user.UserUtils.getUser(UserUtils.java:36)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.UserAction.getUser(UserAction.java:26)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:434)
        at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:51)
        at webwork.view.taglib.PropertyTag.doStartTag(PropertyTag.java:39)
        at __jspPage6_secure_views_navigator_jsp._jspService(__jspPage6_secure_views_navigator_jsp.java:3203)
        at com.orionserver.http.OrionHttpJspPage.service(.:56)
fields.summary: Exception in getUser

fields.description:
The bug is that when resolving an issue and entering a comment in that page, TWO emails are sent out, where only one is needed.

As a general rule though, it'd be nice if emails were a bit more batched. Eg, I might assign an issue to someone, then add in a comment a minute late. It'd be nice if these actions resulted in one email, rather than 2. Maybe have it so there's some kind of queue mechanism, which is flushed 5 minutes after being populated with a 'change'
fields.summary: Too many emails sent out!

fields.description: JIRA should be able to support file attachments. Useful for screen captures (I got this idea when I wanted to upload my screen capture for JRA-162 with the UI all crazy in netscape)
fields.summary: File attachments

fields.description: I have an issue marked as incomplete, clicking on reopen does nothing!
fields.summary: reopen doesn't work

fields.description:
The ability to let a bug affect not just one component, but several, would be really helpful.

The "Component/s:" description of the field in the create issue screen signals that this might be a planned feature.
fields.summary: Bug affecting multiple components

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to change the issue type after the issue/bug/feature request has been made. Users are dumb and can't be expected to classify this stuff.
fields.summary: Change issue type

fields.description: The UI when using Netscape 4.76 is terrible, you should check this out. Try creating a new case, thigns look REALLY bad. This might be a blocker for some my coworkers, as they all are stuck on netscape.
fields.summary: Netscape UI is screwy
Be able to customize outgoing emails per project

fields.description:
When exporting to screen it works fine.

When exporting to a file, the text area is still displayed as empty (which looks like the export didn't do anything).
fields.summary: Exporting to file still displays textarea

fields.description: I find myself often wanting ot see bugs I've filed (to follow up and ensure that they've been resolved to my satisfaction), but there's no option to filter by that.
fields.summary: Being able to filter by reporter

fields.description: I filed this a while back but can't find the bug to reopen it (maybe add lucene for searching through descriptions?!). Basically users have reported much confusion over the 'resolve' button label. Many thought that once an issue is resolved, they can no longer resolve it to be incomplete. Can this label be changed to 'change status' or something similar, just to remove the naming conflict with 'resolved' status?
fields.summary: 'resolve' button unclear

fields.description: Exactly what it says on the tin
fields.summary: Cannot create attachments

fields.description: The login page should not present a forgot password link if external user management is used
fields.summary: no 'forgot password' link when using external user management

fields.description: All dates displayed in emails show up as code, rather than actual dates
fields.summary: Email date formats broken

fields.description: Should be able to 'reopen' an issue by marknig it as unresolved, even after it's been resolved to fixed
fields.summary: No way to unresolve a fixed issue

fields.description:
To reproduce: export from a jira install, import to another server where a project lead for one of the exported projects does not exist as a user. The following exception happens on the admin page:

com.opensymphony.module.user.EntityNotFoundException: No user joe found	at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getEntity(UserManager.java:279)	at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getUser(UserManager.java:109)	at com.atlassian.jira.user.UserUtils.getUser(UserUtils.java:36)	at /secure/admin/default.jsp._jspService(/secure/admin/default.jsp.java:157) (JSP page line 47)

This should error more gracefully, such as the error being localised to that user's project, or switching the project lead to the current admin user and showing a warning message to that effect
fields.summary: Ugliness when project lead not found

fields.description:
Things like this turn up in the output:

params[0] = 10213
params[0] = 
direction = earlier
fields.summary: Debug cruft on System.out

fields.description: Add ability to install a license during the setup wizard
fields.summary: Install License in setup wizard

fields.description: The filter field labels have wrong plurality. Things like "In components/s" should read just "In Components"
fields.summary: Plurality in filters is wrong

fields.description: As reported by Ian Pojman, there are some layout problems on IE5.1 on OSX.
fields.summary: Large spacing in IE5/Mac

fields.description:
Clicking 'create' on the create issue page just refreshes the page. There are no errors on the console, nor in the page itself - just a refresh.

It only happens with people in the group jira-user.
fields.summary: Unable to create issue as jira-user

fields.description:
When JIRA has no license defined, it prints NullPointerExceptions to the console (which are harmless and do not affect operation).

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.license.LicenseUtils.getBytes(LicenseUtils.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.jira.license.LicensePair.<init>(LicensePair.java:27)
        at com.atlassian.jira.license.LicenseManager.getLicense(LicenseManager.java:35)
        at __jspPage32_decorators_admin_jsp._jspService(__jspPage32_decorators_admin_jsp.java:757)
fields.summary: NPE when no license

fields.description:
You currently can't get a filter to show unassigned issues.

Add this capability now that JIRA will allow unassigned issues.
fields.summary: Can't filter to show unassigned issues

fields.description:
The current issue types don't well reflect issues of an 'improvement' nature. New Features aren't the same as improvements to existing features.

Create a new issue type for "improvements"
fields.summary: New Issue Type: Improvement

fields.description: Go to Administration, projects, project details, delete project, then click cancel. You get a blank page.
fields.summary: Clicking Cancel from Delete Project results in blank page

fields.description:
<Midget32> ERROR [(listeners.mail.MailListener)] Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: c
<Midget32> om.opensymphony.module.user.User
<Midget32> java.lang.ClassCastException: com.opensymphony.module.user.User
<Midget32>         at com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.mail.MailListener.getRecipients(Ma
<Midget32> ilListener.java:294)

fields.summary: CCE in MailListener

fields.description: There have been reports (on jira-user mailing list) of problems using JIRA with OC4J. Test it thorougly and add to compatible server list.
fields.summary: OC4J support

fields.description:
Add the ability for users to 'subscribe' to a saved filter. 

Subscription also specifies :
- an 'update' period (how often to check the filter and email the contents)
- whether to email if there is any match (ie email only if there are issues matching a certain filter). 

Using the new services architecture this is quite easy to build.

Depends on JRA-71.
fields.summary: Subscribe-able filters

fields.description:
It looked fine at first, then I ran setup and clicked on "log in now " and I got the following login page: (it's wide, like most pages, not skinny as it should be) JIRA - Login
Profile | Log Out      
   HOME   

Login

Welcome to JM Lafferty Associates
Username
Password   Forgot password    

SIGNUP - for a JIRA account.

JIRA is a J2EE issue tracking system developed by Atlassian.

JIRA BETA: Report bug / feature request
© 2002 - Atlassian - JIRA Version: 0.8.4
Contact Administrators
fields.summary: Incorrect page layout on JBoss

fields.description: IMO, the filter form should have the values of the currently applied filter already "filled out" when you view the page. By presenting the user with a blank form every time, it is almost impossible to tweak a filter because you have to fill out the form every time and remember what you had in there last time. Yes I realize you could use the back button, but that shouldn't be the way to do it. IMO, having to use the back buttos is very hacky.
fields.summary: Filter form not not filled out with values of current filter

fields.description: It would be nice if you could set a persistent cookie that would remember who you are logged in as so you don't have to login each time. You could make this a user preference because I know everybody isn't going to want this on.
fields.summary: Remember Login with persistent cookie

fields.description: The Open Issues report in the project browser shouldn't show versions or components with 0 open issues.
fields.summary: Open Issues report shouldn't show 0's

fields.description: would like to see all issues on a project by assigner and not assignee. assignee is often known by the viewer (the admin for example) and repeated anyway.
fields.summary: View issues by Assigner

fields.summary: NPE when click on issue tag in Issue Navigator

fields.description: Once you're in a particular project, I can't seem to find any way of switching to another project. It'd be nice if there was a selector box at the top of the page with a dropdown of all projects (which only shows up when you have more than one project)
fields.summary: No way to switch projects!

fields.description:
As all project keys are uppercase, the "view Issue #" that is in the right hand side should be case insensitive.

ie convert to upper case.
fields.summary: View Issue # should be case insensitive
